Title: Senior Associate, Creative & Marketing Operations
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
Wayfair is seeking a highly organized and agile Senior Associate to join our Creative Operations team, supporting project and production operations across both Performance Creative (paid social, search, programmatic) and our expanding Owned & Operated channels (email, push, SMS). This role is central to scaling our creative output through sprint-based planning, test-and-learn execution, and close collaboration with both marketing and creative stakeholders.You will lead fast-paced creative workstreams from intake through delivery, adapting to shifting priorities, coordinating across teams, and ensuring projects stay on track. While this role is project-management forward, were also looking for someone whos tech-savvy and open to growing with our evolving creative systems, including exposure to AI, automation, and experimentation platforms.
Who We Are
The Creative Operations team serves as the business owner of our Creative Group. This team drives the long-term strategy, scaling and day-to-day workflow for our diverse set of brands.  With hundreds of initiatives a month spanning all mediums, channels and disciplines, we are the driving force enabling our Creative talent to efficiently and effectively bring our brands to life with eye-catching visuals, strong messaging, and engaging storytelling. 
What Youll Do

Manage creative sprints supporting Performance Marketing and other high volume test & learn initiatives, ensuring projects are briefed, resourced, reviewed by appropriate parties, and delivered correctly and on time
Translate business goals and creative direction into executable timelines and workflows across a variety of asset types and channels
Act as a key cross-functional partner to Creative, Marketing, and Operations, facilitating day-to-day delivery while aligning on larger priorities and testing roadmaps
Collaborate with team leads on roadmap planning, sprint prioritization, and resource forecasting
Own project management systems (e.g., Airtable), driving usage, visibility, and data hygiene
Identify and escalate risks, blockers, or misalignments early, and help problem-solve in real time
Contribute to improving operational processes, sprint cadences, and creative testing systems
Act as a super user and power collaborator across our core tools and platforms, bringing a tech-forward mindset to every sprint
Support the development and maintenance of scalable creative systems (e.g., naming conventions, asset versioning protocols, metadata tagging) to enable performance reporting and automation

 
What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in project or production management, preferably in a creative, marketing, or content-led organization
Proven success executing fast-turn sprint based creative workflows, ideally in paid media, email, and mobile channels
Experience supporting test-and-learn cycles or campaign iteration using performance data or structured feedback loops
Proficiency navigating PM platforms (e.g., Airtable, Jira, Trello, Monday.com); experience onboarding teams or maintaining these systems is a plus
Demonstrated ability to manage concurrent projects with multiple stakeholders, deliverables, and timelines across teams
Familiarity with creative asset development processes, including brief intake, production tracking, QA, and delivery

Title: Workflow Control Manager - Jacksonville, FL
RoleDescription:
Workflow Controller
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future
Not a remote/virtual position

Title: Warehouse Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $66,000 - $72,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Shift: Monday - Friday 5:00pm - 1:30am
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Title: Strategy Lead, Software
RoleDescription:
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $112,000 - $123,500 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
About the TeamThe Strategic Sourcing (Procurement) team drives cross-functional transformation through smarter purchasing, better technology, and a strong focus on business enablement. We sit at the intersection of the business, technology, and finance, ensuring every dollar spent delivers outsized impact. As our technology footprint continues to scale, we drive the strategy for creating a centralized, forward-looking approach to how we buy, govern, and optimize software.
About the RoleWe are seeking a strategic, analytically-minded, Software Strategy Lead to own and evolve Wayfairs enterprise-wide software portfolio. This role is responsible for shaping the long-term technology roadmap in partnership with business and engineering leaders, while also providing commercial and financial discipline to how we invest in software. You will define and oversee governance processes, lead cloud negotiations, and work closely with Finance to ensure ROI from all software spend.
This is a strategic role charged with making sure Wayfair is making the right software investments, at the right time, for the right reasons.
What Youll Own

End-to-End Software Ownership: Oversee Wayfairs entire software portfoliocommercial strategy, governance, financial discipline, and long-term planningacross all business units and functions.
New Tech Roadmap & Strategy: Partner with business, tech, and product leaders to define and drive our strategy for emerging areas (ex. GenAI), identify use cases, and map short- and long-term implementation roadmaps.
Cloud Strategy & Negotiations: Support cloud infrastructure commercial negotiations and partner with technical and business stakeholders to evaluate tradeoffs and shape long-term cloud purchasing strategies.
Software Spend Management: Serve as the key partner to FP&A for forecasting and managing software spend. Build frameworks to evaluate ROI, align spend with business goals, and track impact.
Governance & Decision-Making: Design and evolve software governance processes to ensure technology decisions are timely, strategic, and consistent with Wayfairs broader priorities.
Consolidation & Rationalization: Proactively identify opportunities for consolidation and simplification of software tools. Align roadmaps across stakeholders to realize value and reduce redundancy.
Stakeholder Partnership: Act as a trusted advisor to Engineering, Product, Finance, Legal, and the Executive team on major software decisions and enterprise tech strategy.

What Youll Need:

5+ years of experience in a strategy or operational role with a strong track record using data to identify insights, creating new processes, influencing, and driving results.
Bachelors degree required and preferred in an analytical field, such as economics, math, statistics, supply chain management, analytics, or engineering. MBA is a plus.
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively at all levels of the organization and across different teams.
A strategic thinker who thrives in ambiguity and is excited by the opportunity to shape and define a new area.
An analytical problem solver with strong financial acumen, a data-driven approach to decision-making, and the ability to identify trends within datasets to drive decision-making.
Ability to use data to break down components of purchases and drive the right conversations around the decisions we need to make.
Negotiation experience and/or an understanding of the Software/Cloud landscape is a plus but not required (we can teach you).
A highly organized project manager who can juggle multiple priorities, drive cross-functional initiatives, and ensure flawless execution.
A proactive self-starter who is comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

Title: Senior Manager Software Engineering, Global Supplier Technology
RoleDescription:
Job Title : Senior Software Engineering Manager, Global Supplier Technology
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are
The Global Supplier technology team is responsible for building the scalable platforms for the supplier ecosystem in Wayfair. It starts with establishment of supplier entities, their catalog journey, advertisement, pricing & order management. This platform provides all necessary accelerants for supplier business growth like supplier ads, business insights & recommendations. Play a key role in developing and driving a multi-year technology strategy for a complex platform

Results-oriented, collaborative, pragmatic, and continuous improvement mindset

Title: Senior Designer, Cabinetry & Home Renovation
RoleDescription:
Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry & Home Renovation
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautifuland that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer  Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for design and sales, and you love seeing a great project come to life, this is your stage.
What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.

Title: Senior Associate, Labor Planning
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Final Mile Centers in Norton, MA or Linden, NJ. 
The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

 A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related engineering discipline
 At least 12 years of experience in a senior engineer or technical lead role.
 Should have mentored 10-12 people.
 Experience developing and designing scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of architectural and design patterns, object oriented design, modern

Title: Lead, Business Performance & Strategy
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

RoleDescription:
Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Associate, Marketing Merchandising to join our UK Marketing Merchandising team. This team is responsible for shaping a best-in-class merchandising experience by strategically selecting and presenting products that align with market trends, customer preferences, and business objectives across multiple channels - including TV, onsite, social media, email, and out-of-home (OOH) marketing.
As an Associate, Marketing Merchandising, you will support the development and execution of assortment and merchandising strategies for key promotional and brand campaigns. What Youll Do

Address tactical and operational challenges to ensure seamless merchandising execution.
Collaborate with Category Management and Pricing teams to integrate sales insights, optimize product selections, and identify growth opportunities.

Performance Analysis & Optimization

Analyze campaign and product performance to generate insights, refine strategies, and enhance future curated assortments.
Ensure quality assurance for all merchandise assets, maintaining accuracy and recommending improvements as needed.
Conduct post-campaign reviews to identify key learnings and drive continuous improvement.

Market Research & Trend Forecasting

Ensure merchandising strategies align with business objectives, seasonal trends, and customer insights.

Bachelors degree in Marketing, Advertising, Brand, Business, Economics, or a related field, with experience in buying / merchandising, e-commerce, or retail.

Data-driven mindset, with expertise in analyzing large data sets and deriving actionable insights.

Fluency in English
